title: How to Bake Lemon Crinkle Cookies

steps.headline: Whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt in a mixing bowl.
In the bowl of an electric stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, whip together butter, sugar and lemon zest until pale and fluffy.
Add the lemon juice, lemon extract, vanilla extract, egg and (optional) yellow food coloring and mix together with the wet ingredients until combined.
With mixer set on low speed, slowly add in dry ingredients and mix just until combined.
Pour the powdered sugar into a small, shallow bowl.
steps.description: This will be for coating the dough. It's best to use a shall bowl as there will be more space; however, you can use any kind of bowl.

steps.headline: Scoop dough out about 1 ½ tablespoons at a time (25g each) and shape into a ball.
Drop the dough ball in powdered sugar and roll to evenly coat.
Transfer the dough ball to a parchment/baking paper or silicone lined baking sheet.
Repeat the process with remaining dough and space the cookies about 2-inches (5cm) apart on baking sheet.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 13 minutes.
Cool on baking sheet for several minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool.
Enjoy!
steps.description: Store cookies in an airtight container.

text: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).  Whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt in a mixing bowl.  In the bowl of an electric stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, whip together butter, sugar and lemon zest until pale and fluffy.  Add the lemon juice, lemon extract, vanilla extract, egg and (optional) yellow food coloring and mix together with the wet ingredients until combined.  With mixer set on low speed, slowly add in dry ingredients and mix just until combined.  Pour the powdered sugar into a small, shallow bowl. This will be for coating the dough. It's best to use a shall bowl as there will be more space; however, you can use any kind of bowl. Scoop dough out about 1 ½ tablespoons at a time (25g each) and shape into a ball.  Drop the dough ball in powdered sugar and roll to evenly coat.  Transfer the dough ball to a parchment/baking paper or silicone lined baking sheet.  Repeat the process with remaining dough and space the cookies about 2-inches (5cm) apart on baking sheet.  Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 13 minutes.  Cool on baking sheet for several minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool.  Enjoy! Store cookies in an airtight container.
tyn_model: baking paper or silicone lined baking sheet
